items.title: City Plans Redevelopment for Vacant Area in Lower Manhattan
items.abstract: A mixed-use complex that includes 500 low-to-moderate income housing units is proposed for the Seward Park urban renewal area.

items.title: Rising from the Ashes, Willets Point Redevelopment Will Go Forward, City Says
items.abstract: The project was declared dead in 2015, but Mayor de Blasio says it will be built, without a mall and with 1,100 apartments for low income New Yorkers.

items.title: Tax Breaks for Luxury Towers Spur Redevelopment, and Backlash
items.abstract: Incentives granted to developers have helped fuel urban renewal around the nation. But some wonder whether they are appropriate for projects that cater to the affluent.

items.title: Museum of Fine Arts, Houston Unveils Expansion Design
items.abstract: The museum has revealed designs for a redevelopment of its 14-acre campus, including a 164,000-square-foot-building and a new home for the Glassell School of Art.

items.abstract: The World Trade Center, an X-shaped office tower that has sat empty since 2011, is at the heart of plans to revitalize the area along the Mississippi River.
